techmeme.title: BHP, the world's largest mining company by market cap, warns the rise of data centers and AI could exacerbate a looming shortage of copper by increasing demand (Leslie Hook/Financial Times)
CEO Anne Wojcicki says she remains committed to taking 23andMe private and is "surprised and disappointed" after all seven independent board directors resigned (Ashley Capoot/CNBC)
Amazon names Samir Kumar as the new head of its India consumer business, a month after his predecessor Manish Tiwary's sudden exit, as competition intensifies (Manish Singh/TechCrunch)
Lenovo says the company has started building AI servers in Pondicherry in southeastern India, moving beyond products such as laptops and smartphones (Saritha Rai/Bloomberg)
Prager Metis, a former auditor for FTX, pays a $1.95M fine to settle two US SEC cases, including for alleged negligence in auditing the cryptocurrency exchange (Jonathan Stempel/Reuters)
